doc.after: In March 2014, Serbian volunteers self-identifying as Chetniks travelled to Sevastopol in Crimea to support the pro-Russian side of the Crimean crisis. Chetnik forces are led by a Serb national and Chetnik, Bratislav Zivkovic. They spoke of "common Slavic blood and Orthodox faith", cited similarities with the Cossacks, and claimed to be returning the favour of Russian volunteers who fought on the Serbian side of the Yugoslav Wars.[236]
